website_summaries.verdict: Extremely low price for a small battery-powered generator that charges silently from solar panel.
pros: Battery-powered generator is perfect for camping because it runs silently rather than using a noisy gas generator
Can charge the battery through solar panel

website_summaries.verdict: With up to 14 hours of continuous use, this is a reliable power source for emergencies or camping trips, with solar as just one charging option.
pros: Versatile rechargeable battery pack with multiple inputs, including solar charger connections
Good charge capacity, with up to 14 hours of continuous operation
cons: Solar panels and connectors not included
must buy compatible panels from other manufacturers
Cannot use AC output when charging via solar panel

customer_reviews.title: Resmed AirSense10 Camping REview
customer_reviews.text: I ****HIGHLY**** recommend this battery for CPAP use. This battery was fantastic for my camping trip this weekend. Using the DC adapter for my CPAP I got nearly 18 hours of use out of this. This was of course with no humidification or hose heating. This battery is small and light. I am starting with a 25watt to see how long it will take to recharge. I have been using a UPS at home for backup in case the power goes out but this is a MUCH better option.
customer_reviews.author: GingerMan512

customer_reviews.title: FALSE ADVERTISING!!!!! LIES!! All lies!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so so disappointed!!! This item is NOT as advertised!! It’s WILL NOT CHARGE WITH A SOLAR PANEL NOR WITH MY CARS LIFHTER SOCKET!! Only way to charge is with a cheap thin Ac cord that won’t last you one week!!! It is NOt a generator!! Is just a battery pack that will be useless for dry camping!! Amazon could careless about these reviews! And the power cable was torn and throwing sparks!! I looked for a replacement cord and they are no where to be found!!!! Pass this one up, serio!
customer_reviews.author: Nms

customer_reviews.title: WORTHLESS
customer_reviews.text: It simply doesn't work. I needed it for Hurricane Irma. I charged it for several days. However, when I lost power and needed it... didn't work. Device kept flipping between DC/AC and wouldn't power ANYTHING! I will be returning - even though the original packaging was tossed.
customer_reviews.author: Treasure

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: This thing stopped working the first week it doesn't charge when it needs to it didn't come with instructions it was literally a waste of money for me because it became useless the first week
customer_reviews.author: Hazmat_Huskey

customer_reviews.title: which is great. It can power some things
customer_reviews.text: It comes fully charged, which is great. It can power some things, such as mini fan. The problem I had with this device is that it doesn't charge my iPhone or ipad, I think because it is a modified sine wave. It's probably good for a little lamp or something, but not electronic equipment. The LED light on the back side is very nice. It has two different brightness settings. I would have really liked this device if it could effectively charge smartphones, ipads, and computers.
customer_reviews.author: Lp

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted for 2 weeks. During charging with provided ...
customer_reviews.text: Only lasted for 2 weeks. During charging with provided charger LCD went blank. Will not turn on any more. What a junk.
customer_reviews.author: Tomasz Klys

customer_reviews.title: ... until our power came back on - which was great since we live in Georgia and it was in ...
customer_reviews.text: Was able to power a fan for several hours until our power came back on - which was great since we live in Georgia and it was in the middle of summer, making sleeping unbearable! We were able to get our room cool enough with circulating air that our kids went back to sleep. I like the ability to charge a phone several times if that is all you are using it for and the light was very convenient! Thankfully it came fully charged because our power went out the night that it arrived!!! We have already gotten use out of it twice and bought a second one!
customer_reviews.author: Gennifer

customer_reviews.title: Will NOT be suitable for a CPAP
customer_reviews.text: Ran it fully charged, lasted less than 2 hours for a CPAP. Perhaps it works better on lower wattage devices, but I purchased it for this specific reason. Also, NO solar panels are included. I tried to recharge on my car battery and it made my car battery die, just to recharge. So I guess it depends on what purpose you want it for.
customer_reviews.author: Ladybassmaster

customer_reviews.title: Performs as Expected
customer_reviews.text: This product isn't really a generator, but rather a rechargeable battery with built-in AC inverter. It works well for small "AC" loads which is what I purchased it to do. I haven't recharged the unit yet using the optional Solar connector cable, but plan to using my 50W solar panel. The AC output on the unit was not working, but the seller (Telesport) was quick to replace the unit for me with no hassle. The instructions indicate charging must be manually removed and does not have auto disconnect after battery is fully charged, so I am a bit concerned about potential battery damage from overcharging. I would have given 5 stars if it hadn't been for that.
customer_reviews.author: Slicktop

customer_reviews.title: This is a very reliable battery pack/charging station.
customer_reviews.text: I have now used this for over a year. Got it for Hurricane Irma, and it helped to "spot run" items like my wireless, charged my laptop, Ryobi batteries, fans, and phones, etc. Since that time, I have never had to plug my 2 cellphones, Kindle fire, or laptop into AC to charge, instead I use this DC charger. I live in FL so the battery fully re-charges in 8-10 hours attached to the solar panel depending if it is the rainy season. Then I charge everything overnight.
customer_reviews.author: scubac

customer_reviews.title: I will repost if it does better.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my CPAP machine while camping. It didn't even hold a charge through one night. I am charging it again and will try it again. I am hoping it was just a fluke.... I will repost if it does better.
customer_reviews.author: gz

customer_reviews.title: Impressive start to backup power
customer_reviews.text: I have move on to bigger and better units. But, this is a great opportunity for those starting into this. Major rethink in design would be pure sine wave. Get away from the other inverter type, I know its cheaper. Future roll outs even at a less battery converter capacity should include a pure sine wave inverter. I did really well for the bottom dollar pricing I paid for it. Also, change the battery performance type to li-pro etc. Some of the new models have gone threw upgrades. The two I have currently power three watt led bulbs for several days. Some nice savings from the power company and not major long term life to battery charge life.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this with high hopes it'd be useful for my long camping trip
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this with high hopes it'd be useful for my long camping trip. The title is misleading but what I wanted was a battery pack with a high mAh rating so I purchased this one. I charged it up to full after I received it and immediately took it with me on my trip last weekend. The second time I plugged in my usb cable to it to charge my phone, the battery pack sparked and went completely brick on me. Processing a return for it now. After a pleasant email exchange with the seller I'm bumping my review up. Very well handled.
customer_reviews.author: P Long

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for my CPAP even with DC adapter
customer_reviews.text: Super disappointed as when testing out the battery, it worked at home with a DC converter and my CPAP machine fine but when I tried using it camping did nothing. I could get it to charge my phone so that’s why I am giving it 1 star. I also couldn’t get it to shut off all night. So the indicator light stayed on all night without anything plugged in despite multiple attempts. Especially disappointed as I don’t know if I can get a refund since I bought it many months ago but haven’t used it until this weekend (besides testing it out)
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca L. Jones

customer_reviews.title: I bought this just for my CPAP in case of ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this just for my CPAP in case of emergency, since last year was out of power for 4 days after hurricane Irma. Had to use it this week after power went out during thunder storm and decided to check how many hours it can last.....16 in total!!! ....2 nights of 7 hours sleep (each night), plus lasted 2 hours on the 3rd night. I knew the 3rd night would not last, but wanted to see how much it could last in total. So I was pleasantly surprised. I have a Resmed S9 and used the whole device.
customer_reviews.author: Debora Viego

customer_reviews.title: Power saver!
customer_reviews.text: I used this battery to power my APAP when I travel, using a 12 volt converter plug. After charging fully I was able to use it at least two nights on one charge (up to 4 in cooler weather), and charge it using a solar panel. I charged my phone with it too. Seems to work better out of heat and humidity, but I have saved so much effort by not needing a large battery! I have taken it with my APAP on a plane as well (I pack them together because most airlines don't let you take batteries - but they won't deny you medical equipment).
customer_reviews.author: MisPhred

customer_reviews.title: Nonexistent customer service
customer_reviews.text: The battery itself is amazing. I use a Resmed at a setting of 16, which is quite a bit. With the reservoir off, I used it for two nights and could likely use it for one more. What is bad is the customer service. When I lost the AC charger, I sent an email twice to mt@rockpals.com (apparently the customer service email, and got no response, waiting one month for a response. That’s unacceptable. So, now, I’m off on the quest for a proper AC charger. I know nothing about chargers, so it’s going to be a pricey trial and error quest.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Prentice

customer_reviews.title: Conflicting Information
customer_reviews.text: Packaged well, delivered in a timely manner, light weight, and compact. However, contradictory information.....I purchased this generator specifically to use with CPAP on a three-day. Bare Bones Back to Basics camping trip. It does not hold up to standards with charge.....I have used every night since delivery and the most use I have gotten is 9 hours. Will not serve the purpose for which it was purchased.......
customer_reviews.author: Cint

customer_reviews.title: I now own  5 of these plus a solar charger.
customer_reviews.text: Here in California we seem to be digressing to a more primitive time of unreliable electricity, public toilets and homesteads being established at our front doors and many other primitive life styles. Now, with these puppies I can have a reliable source of electricity to run my cell phones/computers even if the towers are gone. I use these to keep my car battery charged when I'm not using it often. Surviving in the wild, wild west of s. CA has gotten a bit more secure for me. Yes!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I purchased primarily to power my BBQ Pit temperature controllers (IQ200) as I don't always have access to power at the BBQ competitions, and at home its a pain to run the extension cord out to them. Both units connect directly to the 9-12V outputs and run all day and all night without issue, or even registering movement on the charge indicator. Secondarily it serves as a powersupply for my CPAP when I go camping or the power fails. Two nights is not an issue without needing to recharge. I am very happy with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: John Moss

customer_reviews.title: Waste of warranty $$, cause they expire after 1yr & device dies after. Bad buy!
customer_reviews.text: Intended to give 1.5 stars. I've had this a bit over 1 year-ish, RARELY used, and it's already gone dead. I thought if I recharge the battery, it'll give power bank to the device. But evidently it just stopped working all at once, it's not even getting input, let alone output on any devices. I don't know if they'll do free repair or let alone exchange. What a waste of $$$. Can't even get any customer service to contact me back about this product fail.
customer_reviews.author: Fried Tofu

customer_reviews.title: Compact, functional, light weight
customer_reviews.text: I have not had this product long, but I tested each output port; i.e., USB, AC, DC, etc. and the charging input port. All works well. I had a similar type portable battery unit maybe a decade ago and it was much heavier than this one. That unit could actually jump start a car. So, it had a lot more power than this one. But, ion-lithium batteries are very much lighter than the older batteries. This unit is very portable. The read out display is quite clear. The instructions were clear enough, but I had to laugh at times because they were written by someone not totally familiar with the English language. Well, the unit is made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Magpie

customer_reviews.title: doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to run my CPAP while camping. It made it through one night (8 hours), and I recharged it. Only 5 hours the next time, and despite recharging only 4 hours the next night. Definitely does not last a couple nights, and will not work for me to try to use again. Really disappointed --still looking for a good power source for a CPAP when camping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: CPAP battery backup solution that works great
customer_reviews.text: This works great for my cpap. I have a Resmed S9 and I was able to get 20 hours out of this battery at a 12 pressure and no humidifier. You do need to get a 12v to 24v adaptor for the S9 and also Airsense. I got  which worked great. If you need your cpap to sleep and apparently I do now after using it for a few years. Don't wait until your power goes out.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: A solid lifesaver for cpap users.
customer_reviews.text: This was a real lifesaver. I bought this after going through two category 5 hurricanes and had no power for two months. I use a cpap unit and combining this power station with a 12v adapter for the unit would get me an easy two full nights of power. It comes with a 12v charging cable that I would use to recharge it in my car. Every night I would plug in my cpap unit and two USB powered fans and the Paxcess would use less than half of its power for eight hours of use. I plan on taking this with me when I go camping this fall as it is very compact and portable.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for anyone who camps or worried about natural disasters.
customer_reviews.text: I live in Florida, but I don't have a lot of storage for a generator. We lose power occasionally, especially during hurricane season. This is perfect. It is compact, and right now you can get the carrying case with it free! I needed something that would allow me to keep laptops, phones and a recharge batteries. This fits the bill perfectly. I can store it easily, but when I need it, I don't have to worry about being able to stay in contact because my cell phone has died. Being in rescue, having that ability helps me to get furry family members to safety and hopefully home.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl H

customer_reviews.title: Great for my CPAP
customer_reviews.text: This battery runs my CPAP for 2 to 3 nights, with humidifier and heated hose off. I use it frequently while RVing. It does seem to take a long time to charge, but I think it's because of the amount of power it stores. For me, it beats having to get a heavy AGM "car type" battery, at least at this point. If I start going on even more frequent and longer trips, I may have to get an AGM battery to supplement this. Although I did have a charging issue with the first one the company stood behind their product and replaced it.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4 days at Bonnaroo!
customer_reviews.text: Have multiple camping events this summer with limited electric options. Had this fully charged on Wednesday, left that night for Bonnaroo. Kept everyone’s phones and a kindle fire charged and ran a small electric fan for short times when the tent got super hot. Battery finally drained Sunday night/Monday morning when we headed home. Next plan to get solar panels to try to keep it charged.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality device for emergencies!
customer_reviews.text: i bought this unit to power a little water pump thinking i could charge it (via solar panel) while suplying power to the pump thru the day and maybe last the night energizing the pump. i was wrong. this unit is either charging or supplying, but cant do both at the same time. also keep in mind that you should not discharge more than 2/3 or you will loose storage capacity. that said, i charge it during days and use it to charge my cellphone and my wife's at the end of the day. no problem there. unit is nice looking, compact, light weight, lamp works well, good quality product to have around in case of emergencies or camping trips!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Needs better usb charging.
customer_reviews.text: Not bad. Could be better. I dont know the fancy shmancy words that everyone else is using so im dumbing it down to normal people language. Pros: -super portable. Love the handle. -the wall sockets (the 2 power outlets on the right side) work just fine Cons: -the usb charging sucks. Phone shows its charging but while im using it im still losing power compared to whats going in. Side note: i mainly got this for camping and charging my mavic air/ drone on the go. Takes a few minutes for the drone batteries to actually start charging oddly enough. But it does charge em.
customer_reviews.author: Mar2ne

customer_reviews.title: Great Battery pack
customer_reviews.text: This is a great battery pack for use with CPAP machine. I can get 4 nights out of it if the power goes out or on a camping trip. Of course it's great for other related power source requirements, laptop, tablet/cell phone charging. Very good value for the money and very portable. Good job guys. If you built a bigger one that could power most RV requirements, I would purchase it in a heart beat.
customer_reviews.author: Janek C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for CPAP machine 😴
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a back up for my CPAP machine. Tested it with my CPAP without the humidifier and can last 3 days. With a humidifier, one and a half. Noticed after 6 months, it does hold a charge as it use to. Maybe lost around 5 to 10% capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Incredible package, with case and solar panel
customer_reviews.text: Plug in your coffee maker, modem, laptops, iPhone, lights, battery charger and so much more. We buy rechargeable batteries and charge the charger with the AC in this. There is no limit. Keeps modem up for 8-10 hours. Flexible in all ways, using car, solar panel. We take it camping, hunting, tailgate parties and keep three just for emergencies, always charged and ready. A truly ROCKING package. We've given several as gifts as well and everyone raves about them. YouTube has several demos. An engineer took it apart and commented that it is not junk - much higher quality than any of the others he's reviewed.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma

customer_reviews.title: CPAP Camping holds 2 day charge
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a camping trip last year. Had the unit all charged up with accessories to let it sip the power instead of guzzle it. Even with my CPAP heating set to off and not using the water reservoir, it only lasted 2 nights. The unit is easy to use and good for home emergencies. I'm buying a second one so I can take both on my longer camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: Mat Bradley-Tschirgi

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be used / damaged yet sold as new
customer_reviews.text: I just received and unboxed the Power Station. First thing I noticed was there was no seal on the box and the cardboard tab was bent (appeared to have been previously opened), once I opened the box I found the plastic bag crumpled up inside and the display scratched up with no protective sheathing anywhere on the power station. I assumed I was buying a new, not previously opened or damaged item. The product information did not state used or damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E. Lenth

customer_reviews.title: I'd purchase again and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: The does exactly what I need it to do - runs my CPAP for 2 days while I'm camping. I purchased the car adapter cord thingy from my CPAP supplier and this worked perfectly. I did decide to run it without humidity, which my husband says is why it lasted 2 nights without the need of a battery recharge. I also charged my phone with it a few times. I'm thrilled withe the compact size and light weight. I'd purchase again and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: S Kendrick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Perfect sized . I was in need of an emergency battery system that can run breathing treatments if our power goes out . I have small solar cells I’m going to experiment with . It’s so easy to use the light that my 3 yr old turned it on . She could easily carry it too . It’s a bit of an investment , but nothing sucks more than being Stuck without power .Mine did not come with solar panels . I like all the plug ins . I took pics so you can see . Amazon is the best
customer_reviews.author: Spider mom

customer_reviews.title: I am pleased that it is compact and portable
customer_reviews.text: I used this to power a remote 9 volt video camera (dash cam) that I move around to different areas in the house for security purposes. The unit powers the camera for 48 hours. I am pleased that it is compact and portable. The limitation is the 100 watt max output. You can't power too many things with that low an output. Also, the AC outlet cannot accept a 3 prong plug. You must buy an adapter.
customer_reviews.author: John Wood

customer_reviews.title: Being Prepared For a Power Outage
customer_reviews.text: Got to use this on my ResMed CPAP machine when there was a planned power outage in my neighborhood. I had a DC convertor and not sure why it did not work, but when I switched the Inverter to AC and plugged in my cpap, I had no problem till I woke up 6 hours later and still had plenty of power to go longer. Also had read in other reviews, I had my humidifier turned off.
customer_reviews.author: Commdrdave

customer_reviews.title: Compact and works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Can get four days of CPAP use without using humidifier or heated hose. Just turned it off in the programming on the CPAP. So this fits the bill for camping. For now I don't plan on recharging it in the field as four nights would be plenty for me tent camping, LOL! Looking forward to testing it out on a actual trip. BTW, smaller than it looks and that is a good thing. Great find and great price!
customer_reviews.author: LittleI

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR CPAP USE
customer_reviews.text: Bought this primarily for use with my CPAP machine. I travel for a living and sometimes I nap/sleep in my vehicle. Am able to run CPAP without having to leave my vehicle running. Great to have as a back up in case of power outage in the home as well. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jason W. Tawzer

customer_reviews.title: This charger works great with my CPAP
customer_reviews.text: I am a CPAP user, and I need a power source when I go camping or when there is a power outage due to a storm. This battery works great. I put my CPAP in "airplane" mode, plug it into the battery and it will last all night. It will need to be charged fully the next day, but it definitely lasts a full nights sleep. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan D. England

customer_reviews.title: better than nothing
customer_reviews.text: my first portable power station. we get power outages several times a year. thought i could get to give us light so we could continue working, tested it twice the last week and i get about 2 hours of power for one lamp with 100 watt bulb on a full battery charge. not great for what i paid. probably okay if you use for smaller devices or traveling. B- kind of rating, not sorry i bought, good to have, just not blown away.
customer_reviews.author: john washington

customer_reviews.title: Great battery bank. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Great battery bank. Used to charge HT radios and cell phones. Battery lasts a long time. Partnered with a Renogy 100 Watt panel, it charges easy. Very convient to have when the power goes out or for camping/hunting. The reason for only 4 stars is the front display - the cover is cheap plastic that scratches very easily and makes it hard to see the display. I would recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Seemed like a gear idea but it’s about to go in the trash
customer_reviews.text: Bought this awhile ago. Has only worked once. I charge it and then go to use it and it doesn’t turn on except one time it did and that was at home when I was trying it out the first time. Took it camping so I could use my CPAP machine at a campground without power connections and didn’t work at all.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: First impression
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent portable generator. It is smaller than I expected but just as good. The product packaging it came in is ingenious - no wasted space and I will keep it for storage. I have only had it for a day but it did come fully charged which was unexpected. Overall I am very impressed. I will update my review once I have had time to use it more.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfwalker

customer_reviews.title: Great for our needs
customer_reviews.text: This was a purchase for when we went out of town or out for a long time to help with charging all of our phones, ipads, and gaming monitor for my son that requires the 3 prong outlet which this has. It works great! I did have an issue with the first unit that I received but after a email to the company, it was corrected immediately. Great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: kjm

customer_reviews.title: Good battery
customer_reviews.text: Good solution for charging high power devices. I have two AC adapters that require 100w such as my laptop and my charger for DJI drone. Both can charge from this battery backup. Don't expect a lot of charges in such a high wattage device, but it's easy to keep under the seat of a car for emergencies when you don't have any power out and about.
customer_reviews.author: DKP

customer_reviews.title: Great Device
customer_reviews.text: Completely worth the price. I had my doubts cause of it's size but it works great as emergency power supply. We went through a bad hurricane and still have no power in areas so it's been very useful to charge phones and rechargeable battery fans. Would consider buying one with a larger charge supply in the future. Unfortunately couldn't directly ship to my location.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Still testing not impressed yet
customer_reviews.text: I like that the power cell has several outputs USB; AC; DC. I like that it is lightweight, I don't like the light it is not very bright. It powered a short length of Christmas lights in AC mode for about 2.5 hours. I'm not impressed. I purchased the power module for a power backup(due to PG&E black outs) to my Bi-pap machine which I have yet to use.
customer_reviews.author: Tim R.

customer_reviews.title: Did not perform as expected for CPAP!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as promised, fully charged, easy to use. I depend on my CPAP for a good night's rest and was expecting, (based on some of the reviews and an instructional video), up to 2 nights, (7 hours/night)' use during a camp out with my family. I used the A/C power/adapter as recommended without heat/humidifier and it powered up fine so I drifted off to sleep as usual. However, the charge only lasted 4 hours, so I slept fitfully the rest of the night and the next. It was a very disappointing experience to say the least. (I did not use it to charge or power any other devices, i.e. my cell phone).
customer_reviews.author: DeMac

customer_reviews.title: it would be a great option, but our camping trips are never that ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item to take on a camping trip to use with my Resmed Cpap machine. After reading some comments, I purchased an adapter to plug my cpap in to that would convert it to a 12 volt. I also didn’t use the humidifier because I read that uses more power. I only got about 1 1/4 nights out of this battery. That was actually with charging it for about two hours in between the first night and the second. If you only need it for one night, it would be a great option, but our camping trips are never that short. It’s also a little disappointing that there isn’t a solar charger included with the item.
customer_reviews.author: Nas

customer_reviews.title: I have used once with cpap machine using DC output ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used once with cpap machine using DC output. The charge lasted for 20 hours or 2.5 days of sleep. Since this was the expectation and the battery fully recharged in 7.5 hours, i am giving 5 stars but keep in mind that i only used it once so far.
customer_reviews.author: BigE

customer_reviews.title: Lasts longer than claimed.  Excellent Value.  I got 2.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for CPAP when no electricity is available. I get between 2 and 3 7 hour nights out of this. Light weight. Easy to connect and use, Highly recommend. Can be used in tent or camper without hazzard, unlike lead acid batteries. Largely replaced $250 100 amp ASGM Battery which weighed about 50 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: L. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Works well, hopefully it lasts
customer_reviews.text: So far this battery pack has been pretty good. It's easy to charge and supports many kinds of devices. I docked a star because it feels like it's built pretty cheaply. Only time will tell, but I have doubts about durability. I plan to use it while camping and hope it can last a long time. I do think the name is a little misleading because it's not a generator, just a simple battery pack. I did not buy the solar charger because it seems very overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremyk

customer_reviews.title: Works great for CPAP
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my CPAP machine while camping. It works great and will last about seven hours if fully charged. One thing to note is that the humidifier on my CPAP won’t really work with this. I have to turn the humidifier off or the battery will be depleted in two hours instead of seven. I did not buy that separate solar adapter so I cannot speak to that. I charged this in my car while driving or find an outlet at the campground during the day
customer_reviews.author: Bianchiroadie

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: I feel bad for giving this review because I bought two of these and they worked outstanding, and one of them still does...but the other will not turn on anymore. I have only had it for about a month and a half and haven't even used it a whole lot. Again..I believe that these little power packs are awesome, but i have one that is faulty. I contacted Paxcess, but they are not easy to get ahold of.. (they never answer the phone). The one that I have that works is awesome...would honestly only like a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Alan H.

customer_reviews.title: 100 Watt Portable Generator Power Inverter
customer_reviews.text: We bought this power inverter to use for my husbands C-pap breathing machine as there would be no electric power during sleeping hours. It worked like a charm for the 8 hours he needed it each night and still had more left in it. We would recommend this item to anyone needing electricity in areas where it isn't available.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Clifton

customer_reviews.title: THIS MACHINE IS VERY NICE, MY HUSBAND USED THIS FOR HIS SLEEP MACHINE
customer_reviews.text: THIS MACHINE IS VERY NICE,MY HUSBAND USED THIS FOR HIS SLEEP MACHINE,WORK GREAT FOR 3 NICE..NOW I SEND THIS TO MY MOTHER TO PUERTO RICO,SHE STILL WE NO ELECTRICITY AND SHE CHARGE HER 3 CELLULAR FOR 8 DAYS IN THE ROLL..PERFECT SHE LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: MARIBEL TORRES

customer_reviews.title: Only good in charging phones and led lights
customer_reviews.text: it says peak is 150w but when i plugged in my walmart fan which i tested in killawat it was 100w. but a fuse broke when i plugged it in. now i cant use the ac part. i can only use the dc for charging phone, its basically a very big battery bank which i wont use anymore. it says 40800mah but in reality its only 30000 and mine degraded to 20+k. so i wont recommend this to anyone, just spend some more money and get those higher wattage and watt hour like suaoki or aeiusny generator or even the jackery. i ony got this because it was on sale and has a free blue tooth speaker.
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: Worked great when power went out after hurricane
customer_reviews.text: Used this battery to build a solar powered generator for use after hurricanes. Used it for real after Hurricane Irma. While you can't run an air conditioner or a refrigerator off of it, it had no problem powering a small TV, coleman igloo cooler and keeping our cell phones charged until the power came back a few days later.
customer_reviews.author: Guiduchi

customer_reviews.title: Light, Compact, Great for Camping with CPAP
customer_reviews.text: Great for camping if you want a compact, handheld battery. If you need something heavier duty, you're looking at considerable increase in weight and size. I needed it for my CPAP while camping. In DC mode, my CPAP lasted 7-8 hours which was sufficient for one night's sleep. You then need a source to charge it. I did not buy the solar charging panel, but it looks like that would work well if the weather is sunny.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas W. Lim

customer_reviews.title: Lost the Charger, now product is USELESS
customer_reviews.text: Overall the product worked as intended, until I lost the chargers for two power bank. Tried purchasing different cables after guessing which cables may work, yet no success and atleast $30 down the drain. I've looked up and down on this product description and there is NO information about the charger needed, and no way to contact seller...
customer_reviews.author: Noah Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Limited power
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for use with my CPAP. I plugged it in to charge, and hoped it would just keep charging as I used the CPAP. It did not; the charging rate is much slower than the usage rate and after 6 hours it was out of power. On the other hand, we rarely have a power outage that lasts that long. I'l keep it by the bed, and simply move the cord for the CPAP and go back to sleep. The light is a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Methot

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money... kept in RV for emergency use.. once it went dead, it would not recharge... they replaced the unit with a new one and it did the same thing... WILL NOT take a charge now and has only been used once or twice... total junk!
customer_reviews.author: miaoreo

customer_reviews.title: Dreamstation bipap backup
customer_reviews.text: I can confirm that I have tested this as a battery backup for my dreamstation bipap pro. Pressure at 20/4, DC car adapter and no humidifier. Lasted 22.75 hours. Can't comment on the number of recharges because I use it at home and it is always plugged in to the bipap and the ac charger. But it did last almost 23 hours off the battery, which I think is impressive considering the pressure I use.
customer_reviews.author: James greaves

customer_reviews.title: Works Great With CPAP
customer_reviews.text: Lost power for two days. This excellent product provided power for my CPAP for those two nights. I benefited by reading reviews of CPAP users by ordering a Foval DC 12V converter. The combo of the two extended the generator's energy supply. Reading Amazon's reviews reminded me to turn the heater on the CPAP off as well. The generator recharged our two cell phones and ipad during the same two days.This portable generator is small and light weight. Excellent Buy
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold charge very long
customer_reviews.text: It does ok for a cpap if recently charged, however, it will not hold a charge for very long. With no use, the battery discharges in about 24 hrs. on its own. If recently charged, it will run my cpap for about 8 hours. Basically, you have to leave it charging right up until use, so it does work great for power outages but not camping as it will be mostly discharged before you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff and Julie Hines-Honduras

customer_reviews.title: Used Daily since August 2017 - a total of 926 days
customer_reviews.text: I bought this battery pack for a 3 month car trip in 2017 to recharge my phone, kindle and other devices. I've used it daily since then to make sure I had my devices charged and have relied on during a few short term power outages. I don't notice any degradation in recharging. Just recently, we had a power outage and I used the battery pack to power my CPAP machine using the 12 v adapter. Everything worked as expected. I've since then tested it and was able to get 3 nights of power for my CPAP machine with some battery reserve.
customer_reviews.author: George Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: I really like this portable generator. I gave it four stars for two reasons number one I don’t quite think it’s a generator I think it’s more like a rechargeable battery. I used it for camping primarily but I also find it very handy for the kids iPads and so on when we’re on the go. I bought it along with the solar panel and they work seamlessly together. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my fish house
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily to power my small fish house. It runs my radio, lights, and fans with power to spare. I added a 9v to 14v inverter to run the LED lights brighter. Super light weight compared to the lawn tractor battery I was using before that would barely make the night.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a handy-dandy little box! Just what I ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy-dandy little box! Just what I need when I vend at festivals and need to run a small fan, desk lamp and/or power up my iPhone or iPad Mini. I noted some people complained about the inability to hold a charge -- my guess is they got a dud. When working properly, this will power a small fan at full speed for about five hours.
customer_reviews.author: NightOwl

customer_reviews.title: This little charger was a lifesaver.
customer_reviews.text: We were evacuated during the fires and then were part of the PGE black outs. This little charger helped me keep my cell phone charged and I even got to watch a movie on my portable DVD player. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the light
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple goal zero battery packs. This one appears to be on par with them and possibly better because it has a cool light feature, ( don't have to use outlet for light) and weighs next to nothing. Will update if problems arise.
customer_reviews.author: HappyCaretaker

customer_reviews.title: Nice back up
customer_reviews.text: Used it 2 nights in a row for my CPAP and probablycould have gone 2 more nights. Also good for charging phones,etc. Great for camping or power outage. But it does take awhile to recharge.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzy

customer_reviews.title: I love it so
customer_reviews.text: I ran my T.V. for 3 1/2 hours off not even a full charge! I love it so far
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlin E. Oriti

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting or needing.
customer_reviews.text: I was given to believe that this would power my CPAP. Well, it did, for less than three hours, before it was dead. And it took forever to try and charge it up from my car during the power outage. Was basically useless to me.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Dandridge

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4 hours only
customer_reviews.text: I might have to return it. It only lasted on my cpap 4 hours. I will try it with the moisture turned off next time. We live in the desert and really need the moisture.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Hinkle

customer_reviews.title: Not really good for cpap without additional (purchased) adapter
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like the fact that it was advertised as a cpap battery when in fact it would apparently provide only 5 hours of use. An additional adapter (purchase) was needed to provide the capability for a full night sleep. On that basis, (info from factory rep) I returned the unit and purchased the 250 watt unit. Price with discounts was cheaper at their site. Used this new unit and it provided power for 9.5 hours with some reserves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: Used it mostly to powerand charge cellphones. My test run at home had the fan running for more than 12 hours with only one bar of power. Proved useful for hot summer camping in the western planes states.
customer_reviews.author: A. Que

customer_reviews.title: Finally had a chance to try it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to power my CPAP when we lost power. Finally had the chance last night. Plugged my CPAP in and turned it on and it worked. Good new. Only down side is that it only lasted for 6 hours until the battery was completely drained. Not enough for a full night of sleep. Wish the capacity was bigger.
customer_reviews.author: T C

customer_reviews.title: Small, light, and reasonably workable
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit light duty, and I should probably sprung for something with twice the watt-hours. Not a bad price, and recharges quickly and easily from a 20W portable, or 30W fixed solar panel I have. The 100W panel is possibly a bit much.
customer_reviews.author: "Griz" Apple

customer_reviews.title: A good Nights sleep
customer_reviews.text: There was a planned power outage in my area at night and I cannot sleep in total silence so I ordered this to plug my white noise machine into, I charged it up, which takes a pretty long time at least an hour or so, but the charge held up with the machine plugged in and running for the entire 7 hours that the outage was for. I would recommend this for purposes as I used it for and it's specs also say it's good for CPAP users which I am not but thought I would toss that in there.
customer_reviews.author: K Renner

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up great product.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this like 2 yrs and never used it but just in case ukno and surprisingly it still turns on thumbs up for electric survival I mean I would use this for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Hector90.

customer_reviews.title: Sooooo useful
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I just got back from a 2 week camping trip and this thing held up perfectly. I was able to keep all of my devices charged and only had to recharge it once in the 2 weeks while keeping 3 phones, a tablet and an electric toothbrush topped off.
customer_reviews.author: N. Jarrin

customer_reviews.title: Check reviews for the best battery for your CPAP.
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for a light weight charger, but not enough charge for my CPAP. I bought this power pack so that I could take my CPAP camping. Unfortunately, it just didn't have the power needed for my machine. I have a Phillips Respronics Dream Station with a setting of 14. I tried this for two nights at home and couldn't get any more than 4 hours use before it was completely dead. I contacted amazon and had no problem returning the unit. I hope this review is helpful to others that have the same type of CPAP with similar settings to mine.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Faulkenbury

customer_reviews.title: I have used other similar products for a lot more money and have often been disappointed. I was thrilled with this until and I ...
customer_reviews.text: received a defective product and customer service replaced it so quick and so friendly I didn't even care. When the new one arrived it works so well its worth the wait of a replacement unit. I have used other similar products for a lot more money and have often been disappointed. I was thrilled with this until and I use it every day for my work as I need a USB and power outlet on a rooftop daily in my job.
customer_reviews.author: Arizona Guy

customer_reviews.title: I HIGHLY recommend the 100-Watt Portable Generator Power Station
customer_reviews.text: I am disabled and have a Sleep Number bed that requires power to function. I bought this for those occasions when the power might go out while I am in bed. With that said, it has the added advantage of charging my wheelchair, cell phones, computers, etc. I HIGHLY recommend the 100-Watt Portable Generator Power Station.
customer_reviews.author: Refrain Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Great cutomer sevice and product
customer_reviews.text: Product is fantastic, used it for my wifes cpap on trips. last a long time and maks no noise. I had a small issue and the customer service was fantastic. quick and very helpful. If you need portable power, this is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: MaS

customer_reviews.title: Battery display unreliable, but otherwise good.
customer_reviews.text: It works very well and does what it's supposed to, but it has a serious issue with the accuracy of the battery display. While in use, it will show that it has 4 out of 5 bars of battery left, but when plugged in to charge will show that it was actually down to 2 out of 5 bars. It makes a high pitched whining noise when charging off of the cigarette lighter in the car and charges very, very slowly this way, but I think that's to be expected. I use it in my van to charge my phone and power an LED lightbulb at night and it works very well for that.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Koddo

customer_reviews.title: Great little battery pack otherwise
customer_reviews.text: What I origanally bought this for doesnt seem to be working. I bought this for my Bipap machine but I cannot find a a/c to d/c converter that works to power my Bipap machine to keep running all night. I will use it to charge phones and other little appliances until then. Great little battery pack otherwise. Easy to use. Any ideas on what converter to buy would be helpful. Would like to use this if my power ever goes out in my house.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Watts

customer_reviews.title: Handy and efficient
customer_reviews.text: It helped us during IRMA Hurricane. I must have charged it and recharged it at least 6 times. I plugged the laptop for 2 hours, I fully charged e phones, I charged an 18 V battery and plugged a fan for 1 hour. All of that with one charge. At night, I only plug the fan and lasted for 4 hours. I did not like that the level of charge light is not very clear.
customer_reviews.author: G. perez

customer_reviews.title: Ran a CPAP (without a Humidifier) for four nights, ...
customer_reviews.text: Ran a CPAP (without a Humidifier) for four nights, 27 hours total with out a charge. Not powerful enough for a small heater due to watts, but I was able to run a small fan on it with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: MANDS

customer_reviews.title: Great Portable Generator.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for an upcoming camping trip for my CPAP. I tested it last week and plugging my it directly into the unit. My CPAP with the humidifier turn OFF and running for 7 hours only used 50% of the battery. I did track the actual time of the recharge but it wasn’t long at all.
customer_reviews.author: William Neiderhofer

customer_reviews.title: AC side of unit did not work at all regardless ...
customer_reviews.text: AC side of unit did not work at all regardless of what mode it was in. Verified with multi-meter - not current out of any of the outlets on that side regardless of mode.
customer_reviews.author: 425guy

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: So far works great. I purchased two of these to run my aquaclear 110's on my aquariums during a power outage. Each one will run 2 Aquaclears for about 8 hours before getting down to 2 bars left. The price was great and I got a free storage case. I'm happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Sherluthien

customer_reviews.title: compact, portable, camping accessory
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my CPAP while tent camping in the boondocks. It wont run the CPAP and the humidifier, but runs just the CPAP all night. I think it would probably go two nights, but I recharge in the truck during the day. I was thinking of getting a small generator but this is so small I can take it anywhere, and don't have to worry about fuel. The best camping accessory I have bought in a long time! I would give it 10 stars if I could!
customer_reviews.author: John Studstill

customer_reviews.title: Too small for 2 nights on a CPAP machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit specifically to power my CPAP machine while camping. Very disappointed when it quit midway through the second night. Most reviews I read said to expect 2-3 full nights use on a charge. Yeah it charges cell phones well, and has a decent light for tent camping, but this unit IS NOT the answer for camping with a CPAP machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A solar charger is NOT included.
customer_reviews.text: THE product itself is great. The reason for only a 4 star rating is the ad gives the impression it is charged through a solar panel. But what is not clear, unless you read the fine print is that the solar panel costs as much as the generator.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted just over a year (insert sad face)
customer_reviews.text: Bought May 2018 and died June 2019. Only lasted 13 months, and used just a handful of times. Battery is dead and doesn't turn on or charge.
customer_reviews.author: dmperfection

product_meta.title: 100-Watt Portable Generator Power Station, 40800mAh 151Wh CPAP Battery Pack, Home Camping Emergency Power Supply Charged by Solar Panel/Wall Outlet/Car with Dual 110V AC Inverter, DC 12V, USB Ports
product_meta.description:
Paxcess 100W Power Station – Charge Your Life!

It is a versatile, convenient, large capacity power pack which combines 110V AC inverter, DC 12V and USB ports, designed to run lights, phones, laptops and small appliances in an off-grid or power outage situation. Great for emergency, camping, weekend trip or wherever you need power anytime anywhere.

Why Choose Paxcess?

One-in-all Portable Power Station: A portable battery powered generator alternative is a rechargeable power source for personal electronic devices and small appliances. 

Huge Capacity for Outdoor Life: Features 150 WH battery capacity and versatile outputs (USB, AC and 12V) for charging Up to 18 recharges on most phones, like iPhone and Android through the 2.1A USB port. Get 1 to 2 recharges on small laptops and up to 2-3 nights for CPAP machine with DC/DC converter from your CPAP machine and the humidity turned off.

Gasoline-free Generator Alternative: The Paxcess 100W stores energy in a rechargeable, 12V Lithium polymer battery and operates without fumes or noise for safe, silent, clean way to power up your devices anywhere. 

Charge It Anywhere: Easily recharge from an AC outlet at home in about 8 hours, from a 12V outlet in about 13 hours, or from a solar panel in up to 8 hours depending on solar conditions and the size of the solar panel.

Travel Friendly: only 3.3-lbs with an easy-carry handle, an ideal shape and size for traveling, fits perfectly in the backseat to keep power-hungry devices charged on long road trips. 

Reliable Quality: Paxcess power station is built-with only premium components. Its sturdy, drop-tested, fire-resistance shell is used to bear the rigors of your outdoor adventures.
feature_bullets: POWERFUL AC, USB AND 12V OUTPUTS KEEP ALL YOUR DEVICES CHARGED UP: Whether you’re looking to keep iPhone, iPad, laptop, DSLR camera charged up, or running lights, CPAP machine and small appliances in an off-grid or power outage, the Paxcess portable power station features a variety of outputs, including 3* 12V DC port(max 180W,with an extra cigarette socket cable) / 2* 110V AC outlet inverter(modified sine wave, max 100W) / 2* USB 5V port, to ensure you have the power you need at any time

EASILY RECHARGED FROM SUN, WALL OUTLET OR CAR: No matter where you go, keep Paxcess portable generator charged through 3 easy ways: Simply use the included AC adapter from wall outlet to charge up the Paxcess generator in 7-8 hours. On the go, use Paxcess 50w solar panel to charge it from the power of the sun and works as a portable solar generator(The compatible solar panel is sold separatly). Lastly, charging while on-the-road is easy with the included 12V car charger cable.

CLEAN ADN PORTABLE POWER, NO GASOLINE REQUIRED: Since there’s no gasoline required and no toxic fumes, the Paxcess generator is completely safe to use inside your house, tent, and car. It’s also silent which makes it the perfect generator alternative to have on hand for any event; Only weights 3.3lbs and ideal size for traveling, fits perfectly in the backpack or backseat on long road trips.
SAFETY GUARANTEED: Battery Management System (BMS) undertakes voltage control, temperature control and more advanced safety operations, ensuring complete protection for you and your devices.

100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEE: At Paxcess, your satisfaction is our first priority, that's why we offer you 100% satisfaction guarantee. If you are not satisfied with your purchase within 45 days, you can return with 100% money back. No hassles, no question asked. If your generator failed within 1 year time, we will send you brand new replacement. 100% Risk Free.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars551 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
